Full Description: Caraa is a next-generation luxury fitness brand that bridges high fashion with performance features. Based in New York City, our product offerings include bags and accessories for inside and outside of the fitness studio, designed for millennial women living perpetually active lifestyles. Caraa was founded to address major white space in the millennial consumer market. The most active generation yet, 81 percent of millennials practice group fitness vs. 61 percent of their baby boomer parents. This overwhelming majority factors the location and timing of their fitness class around their daily routine. While there are significant number of active apparel brands to address this demand, the options for well made, versatile, and luxurious sports bags are practically nonexistent. We collected data across 12 major US metropolitan areas and saw that 86 percent of millennials who exercise daily carry separate bags for the studio/gym and office, and nearly 100% of them are in the market for a singular bag that can be used from morning until night, seamlessly transitioning between work, fitness, and social activities. We have since created the world’s first “luxeletica” collection: the perfect set of hybrid handbags that strike balance between craftsmanship, quality, and sport functionalities. To disrupt the traditional luxury leather goods and accessories market, we source our materials from Milan, Italy and use the same luxury nylon, leather, and hardware as luxury brands like Chanel and Louis Vuitton, but charge honest retail prices below $500. Our products have high function design features including tech compartments, hidden air ventilation, and water-repellent and moisture-wicking materials. Our creative director and co-founder Carmen Chen Wu is a CFDA award winner with over six years of experience in luxury fashion, including stints at Marchesa, Alexander Wang, Erdem and Vivienne Tam.

Description: Pleotint LLC is a leader in advanced glass technologies, with a special focus on its proprietary self-tinting Suntuitive® dynamic glass.
Headquarters Regions: Great Lakes, Midwestern US
Full Description: Pleotint develops and sells self-tinting dynamic glass windows for architectural and other applications called Suntuitive®.  Pleotint was founded by Harlan Byker, Ph.D., the sole inventor of the electrochromic (EC) technology used by Gentex Corporation (NASDAQ:GNTX) in its auto-dimming automotive rearview mirrors.  As a result of that invention, Gentex is worth over $5 billion today.   Suntuitive utilizes thermochromics, a completely different technology than the EC technology used by Gentex.  It’s also significantly different than the solid-state EC technology used in its competitors' products.  Suntuitive is a robust commercial product that Pleotint is selling, and the company believes that Suntuitive will have broader appeal than the EC windows as Pleotint ramps up its marketing efforts and generates greater awareness that Suntuitive exists and is a great alternative, energy-efficient product.  Suntuitive is the only dynamic glass technology that does not require electricity and human and/or software intervention or controls to work.  Suntuitive dynamic windows are based on a sunlight-responsive, thermochromic interlayer, which is activated by heat from direct sunlight, causing the window to tint as necessary.  The thermochromic elements are embedded in a PVB (polyvinyl butyral) interlayer, which is then laminated between two sheets of glass.  This laminate is then incorporated into the final product, a dynamic insulated glass unit (d-IGU). The Suntuitive interlayer darkens in direct sunlight to block excess solar heat gain. It also blocks virtually all the ultraviolet, while maintaining a view and maximizing daylighting since it clears up in the absence of direct sunlight (https://suntuitiveglass.com/optimized-daylighting/).  There is no electricity used to make this resilient product work and the window unit installs in the same way a traditional unit does. Suntuitive adapts to all seasons and weather, and the glass tints to a neutral gray. Tinting takes place only when there is direct sun and the potential for excess solar heat gain. The tinting is largely independent of ambient temperatures.  Our competitors’ EC windows add complexity, as they have to be hardwired in the building, require electricity and controls to work, and tint to blue.  Suntuitive windows are at pricing parity with those EC windows prior to their added costs for wiring and controls.  Suntuitive is the only truly “green” dynamic window on the market.
